TopicTitle: The Dark Side Epic Easy Challenge Of Epicness

Articles.Content:
Kerbalkind, today is the dawn of a new era.

We have a new world opened for us. :

Looks like it's time for...

THE DARK SIDE EPIC EASY CHALLENGE

OF EPICNESS!!!!!

Listen up, gentlemen!

Boss says our major competitor, Derpal Space Program, is short on cash and has cut the line to their minefield on the dark side of our dear Kearth!

We need you to conquer this new land!

The dark side must be ours!

I know what you're thinking, Bob! What do you do?

I need you to build and fly a rocket that can take off from Kearth, enter orbit, fly to and land safely on the dark side of Kearth, then reenter orbit, then return within high-speed rescue boat range of KSP HQ!

No, Jeb, they can use parachutes!

Parachutes are allowed to assist in both landings, but if you use them we all know you're not a true thrillmaster. 8)

I have an infinite fuel engine i wanna use it lolololol

Get outta here, Kerbhead! Only Sunday Punch's, C7 Aviation, and that other pack that has something to do with donut research are allowed! Of course, using only standard parts is bonus points! Also, you will get super-bonus points for landing on the runway of KSP HQ with a spaceplane as your final landing! ;D

I ALSO DEMAND A PHOTO LOG OF YOUR TRAVELS, GENTLEMEN.

We will need something to show those poor Derpal Kerbheads! ;P

Well, WHAT ARE YOU DOING, BOYS! GO GO GO! >

Of course, there is a slight chance our info is wrong and Derpal didn't cut their lines. In that case, Kerbspeed, gentlemen, kerbspeed.
One moment, I'll be back.
Can we use captainslug's lander legs?

If you must, yes.

If you can without them, you're pretty darn good.
Enter orbit as in, complete one orbit or just make it to orbital heights before dropping back in?
Maintain an orbital trajectory until you reach the dark side.

how about make it a challenge and only have custom parts?

Edit: I mean Standard

how about make it a challenge and only have custom parts?

Edit: I mean Standard

Have fun with that 'Oh boi I'm gonna make my first landing!' *gets to ground, here psssh sound*

'NOOOOOOOOOOOO'

Especially since it takes like, 20 minutes to makea nother full rotation.

One moment, I'll be back.

Ditto.

It. Is. ON!

If I'd ever had a successful landing (which I haven't other than parachute) I would participate. But I haven't. And I like it that way. ;P

P.s. GO SORDID!!!!!

I went, and I failed! Much like Top Gear, I am ambitious but rubbish.

A few seconds after the last picture was taken, my plane lost a wing during re-entry and tumbled helplessly into the side of a mountain.

You can't just admit defeat soldier! Just like on Top Gear, what you need is...

Wait for it...

[move][glow=purple,20,500]POWWWWWEEEEERRRRRRR!!![/glow][/move]

Ditto.

It. Is. ON!

Oh, don't be such an itty bitty little twinkie pinkie!
Wtf?
Sounds interesting.

Wtf?

Just a little in-joke those not in the herd won't get.

Also, I'd like to say my fail was entirely due to pilot error, the ship is more than capable of achieving this feat. I'll try again tomorrow.

Oh. Okay. I await your success! I shall not breathe until you accomplish this task!

For a few seconds anyway.
I've been working on this for 48 hours... Almost had it once, I managed to land an entire 3 stage rocket on the dark side. Then I fat fingered the launch and jettisoned the bottom stage at 700m : /

I've been working on this for 48 hours... Almost had it once, I managed to land an entire 3 stage rocket on the dark side. Then I fat fingered the launch and jettisoned the bottom stage at 700m : /

Should've used stage lock!

A few seconds after the last picture was taken, my plane lost a wing during re-entry and tumbled helplessly into the side of a mountain.

I was wondering how on earth you could lose a wing at that point.

My plane hit the atmo while boosting straight downwards. I see what happened now. XD
When I reenter my plane just spazzes out and rips itself apart. :-\
Yeah, it looks like if you hit atmo at orbital speeds.... your plane had best be very well reinforced XD Mine managed to survive, and I just barely regained control, at around 2000m XD
You just aren't re-entering properly.
Just follow the trajectory of the reentry precisely and you should be fine.
That's easier said than done.
